cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi ESE of Charleston, South Carolina and 325 mi S of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, expected to make landfall along the eastern North Carolina coast, then track across southeast Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula toward the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern North Carolina coast (near Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE including Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach and the Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from Surf City, NC northward through the Delmarva Peninsula and southern New Jersey, including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Sunday as the center moves north of the Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay, including Baltimore’s waterfront
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain Saturday night through Sunday with locally higher amounts causing urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and minor coastal flooding; isolated tornado risk in the Mid-Atlantic coastal plain
